newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian Brasov city to launch municipal bonds.
newsitem.headline: Romanian Brasov city to launch municipal bonds.

text.p: Romania's city of Brasov has signed an arrangement to launch municipal bonds through a consortium linking Salmon Brothers and local securities company SIRA Invest SA, a SIRA official said on Thursday.

The Transylvanian town plans to raise up to $150 million in municipal bonds under a deal similar with an arrangement previously signed with the city hall of Romania's Black Sea port of Constanta, the official said.

The deal involves up to $50 million in a private placement and a public issue of about $100 million Eurobonds. The issue targets local and foreign investors and are expected to hit the market in the first half of 1997.
In August, Romania's capital Bucharest announced plans to raise about $200 million in bonds through Merrill Lynch International to upgrade the city's infrastructure.
The city hall of Sinaia, a ski resort north-west of Bucharest and close to Brasov, also said it would launch domestic bonds worth 200 billion lei ($60 million) in the last quarter of 1996.

Romania won its first credit ratings from major agencies in March. Japan Credit Rating agency awarded it a BB-plus score, somewhat higher than the BB- minus ratings of Standard and Poor's and IBCA and BA-three from Moody's Investors Service. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
